description: Demolition of existing wall and to reinstate/reconstruct the original burr rubble wall, which was removed.
decision_conditions:
CONDITION: Notwithstanding the drawings and details hereby approved,  the following shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority:

1) Samples and full details of all materials and mortar to be used (including any rubble, stones and bricks) in the replacement wall shall be submitted prior to any work commencing on site

2) Full details (including plans 1:10) of the layout/ design/ pattern of the materials used in the wall shall be submitted prior to any work commencing on site 

3) Full details of the wall and its slope (including plans 1:10); responding to the slope of the street shall be submitted prior to any work commencing on site. It shall respond to the sloping nature of adjacent original burr rubble walls along Whitehall Park.

REASON: In order to protect and enhance the special character and interest of the Whitehall Park Conservation Area and to preserve the unique burr rubble front boundary walls in the area, in accordance with the adopted Whitehall Park Conservation Area Guidelines 2002.
